00028 namespace detail {
00029 
00030 std::vector<int> sieveOfEratosthenes(int upTo) {
00031     std::vector<int> sieve;
00032     sieve.reserve(upTo);
00033 
00034     // Zero and one aren't prime, by definition.
00035     sieve.push_back(0);
00036     sieve.push_back(0);
00037 
00038     for (int p=2; p<upTo; ++p) sieve.push_back(p);
00039 
00040     std::vector<int> ret;
00041 
00042     int *p=&sieve[0], *e=p+upTo;
00043     while (p<e) {
00044         if (*p==0) { ++p; continue; }
00045         ret.push_back(*p);
00046 
00047         int *p2=p+(*p);
00048         while (p2<e) { *p2=0; p2+=*p; }
00049 
00050         ++p;
00051     }
00052 
00053     return ret;
00054 }
00055 
00056 // The Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00057 int isProbablePrimeBaseB(const integer& n, const integer &b, callback_t
00058     callback)
00059 {
00060     const integer nMinus1(n - integer::one());
00061 
00062     // Find r and a satisfying: n-1=2^a * r, r odd
00063     integer r=nMinus1;
00064     unsigned long a=0;
00065     while (r.even()) { r >>= 1; ++a; }
00066 
00067     // We check the congruence class of b^((2^i)r) % n for each i
00068     // from 0 to a - 1. If any one is correct, then n passes.
00069     // Otherwise, n fails.
00070     integer test=powmod(b, r, n);
00071     if (test==integer::one() || test==nMinus1) return 1; // Better than 3/4 chance it's prime
00072 
00073     while (a-->0) {
00074         test=sqrmod(test, n);
00075         if (test==nMinus1) return 1;
00076     }
00077 
00078     if (callback && !callback()) return -1;
00079     return 0;
00080 }
00081 
00082 integer random_prime(base_random_generator& gen, size_t size_in_bits, callback_t
00083     callback)
00084 {
00085     if (size_in_bits < 2) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("cannot create "
00086         "prime numbers smaller than two bits");
00087 
00088     // Call the callback for the first time
00089     if (callback && !callback()) return integer::zero();
00090 
00091     integer pe=pow2(size_in_bits+1);
00092     while (1) {
00093         integer p(random_by_size(gen, size_in_bits, true, true, false));
00094         while (p < pe) {
00095             int r=is_prime(p, callback);
00096             if (r < 0) return integer::zero();
00097             if (r == 1) return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(p);
00098             p+=2;
00099         }
00100     }
00101 }

00103 } // namespace detail
00105 
00128 int is_prime(const integer& n, callback_t callback) {
00129     static std::auto_ptr<boost::mt19937> gen;
00130 
00131     if (n < 2) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("xint::is_prime cannot test "
00132         "numbers below 2");
00133 
00134     // First we trial-divide it by the primes below 2000
00135     static const std::vector<int> cLowPrimes(detail::sieveOfEratosthenes(2000));
00136     std::vector<int>::const_iterator i=cLowPrimes.begin(), ie=cLowPrimes.end();
00137     for (; i!=ie; ++i) if ((n % *i)==0) return (n==*i);
00138 
00139     // Ensure that we've got a random generator.
00140     if (gen.get() == 0) gen.reset(new boost::mt19937(time(0)+clock()));
00141     detail::random_generator<boost::mt19937> random(*gen.get());
00142 
00143     // Run the number through the Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00144     // a few times to see if it's actually (probably) prime.
00145     for (int count=0; count<5; ++count) {
00146         unsigned int k = random();
00147         int isP=isProbablePrimeBaseB(n, k, callback);
00148         if (isP <= 0) return isP;
00149     }
00150     return 1; // Appears to be prime!
00151 }
00152 
00154 int is_prime(const fixed_integer_any& n, callback_t callback) {
00155     return is_prime(integer(n), callback);
00156 }
